alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Warning issued October 11 at 3:14AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TYPHOON BOLAVEN INTENSIFYING RAPIDLY NORTHWEST OF TINIAN... .NEW INFORMATION... Typhoon Bolaven is now moving away from the Marianas, however hazardous conditions could still continue for several hours. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. .Watches/Warnings... A Typhoon Warning continues for Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Tropical storm warning and a Typhoon Watch continue for Guam. A Flood Watch is in effect for all of Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards. .STORM INFORMATION... At 1 AM ChST...the center of Typhoon Bolaven (15W) was located near Latitude 15.6N...Longitude 144.7E. This was About 145 miles north of Guam. Storm Motion was north-northwest at 12 mph. Storm Intensity was 85 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... Typhoon Bolaven continues to move away from the Marianas, however hazardous conditions could still continue for several hours. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 AM ChST...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Warning remains in effect... ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... ...Winds... The threat for destructive Typhoon force winds has diminished as Bolaven departs. However, damaging tropical storm force winds of 39 mph or higher will continue overnight. Winds are expected to fall below tropical storm force by late this morning, and will then be southwest to south 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. ...Storm surge and storm tide... The peak inundation threat has passed but minor inundation of 1 to 2 feet is still possible during high tide around 5 AM this morning. ...Inland flooding... A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect for the entire area. Additional rainfall of 2 to 5 inches is possible through Wednesday morning. The highest amounts are expected for Rota as the more-widespread showers are found south of the center of Bolaven. See the latest forecasts for the most up-to-date information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location, and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Soils are already wet from previous rainfall, so it won`t take much to cause flooding.
info.instruction: Even though Bolaven is moving away from Guam and the CNMI, dangerous conditions persist and warnings continue. Remain in shelter until officials have given the all-clear. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast.
